This effect has been observed in Zika incidence data [ 14, 17, 26, 27], but it was frequently confounded with gender-related underreporting; however, from our estimates of the male underreporting, we conclude that underreporting can account for only a 20% drop, with the rest of the difference being explained by the excess in female cases due to sexual transmission.
